sentences.sContent: Car thefts are commonplace in this part of town.
sentences.sCn: 镇上的这个地段盗车案屡见不鲜。

sentences.sContent: It is a commonplace to say that Northern Ireland is a backwater in the modern Europe.
sentences.sCn: 说北爱尔兰是现代欧洲死气沉沉的落后地区已是陈词滥调了。

exam.question: In the late 19th century, Jules Verne, the master of science fiction, foresaw many of the technological wonders that are ______ today.

answer.explain: commonplace： 平常的。句意： 19世纪末期， 科幻小说大师儒勒·凡尔纳预见了许多今天常见的科技奇迹。transient： 短暂的； implicit： 暗示的； elementary： 初步的， 基本的。

synos.tran: 老生常谈；司空见惯的事；普通的东西

remMethod.val: common(普通的) ＋ place(地方) → 普通的

trans.tranOther: happening or existing in many places, and therefore not special or unusual
something that has been said so often that it is no longer interesting or original
